content.1: And afterward Moses and Aaron went in, and told Pharaoh, Thus saith the
content.3: And they said, The God of the Hebrews hath met with us: let us go, we pray thee, three days’ journey into the desert, and sacrifice unto the
content.4: And the king of Egypt said unto them, Wherefore do ye, Moses and Aaron, let the people from their works? get you unto your burdens.
content.5: And Pharaoh said, Behold, the people of the land now
content.6: And Pharaoh commanded the same day the taskmasters of the people, and their officers, saying,
content.7: Ye shall no more give the people straw to make brick, as heretofore: let them go and gather straw for themselves.
content.8: And the tale of the bricks, which they did make heretofore, ye shall lay upon them; ye shall not diminish
content.9: Let there more work be laid upon the men, that they may labour therein; and let them not regard vain words.
content.10: And the taskmasters of the people went out, and their officers, and they spake to the people, saying, Thus saith Pharaoh, I will not give you straw.
content.11: Go ye, get you straw where ye can find it: yet not ought of your work shall be diminished.
content.12: So the people were scattered abroad throughout all the land of Egypt to gather stubble instead of straw.
content.14: And the officers of the children of Israel, which Pharaoh’s taskmasters had set over them, were beaten,
content.15: Then the officers of the children of Israel came and cried unto Pharaoh, saying, Wherefore dealest thou thus with thy servants?
content.16: There is no straw given unto thy servants, and they say to us, Make brick: and, behold, thy servants
content.19: And the officers of the children of Israel did see
content.20: And they met Moses and Aaron, who stood in the way, as they came forth from Pharaoh:
content.21: And they said unto them, The
content.23: For since I came to Pharaoh to speak in thy name, he hath done evil to this people; neither hast thou delivered thy people at all.
